moduleGoal: Build the programmer mindset and understand how C programs are written, compiled, and executed.
outcomes: Write and run basic C programs
Use variables, data types, and basic I/O correctly

topics: Where C is used (OS, embedded, compilers)

theory: Why is C called a procedural language?
Why is C still relevant today?
Explain the steps of program execution.
Why is C faster than many languages?
practical: Write a program to print Hello World
Write a program to print your name, age, and city
Write a program to print numbers from 1 to 5 (without loops)
Write a program with a syntax error and fix it
Write a program that prints a sentence in two lines
Write a program that prints your college name in a box
Modify Hello World to print your name instead
Write a program that prints today’s date
Write a program that prints “C Programming Started”
Compile and run a program and note the output

theory: What is the return type of main()?
What happens if main() is missing?
Why is semicolon important in C?
Difference between single-line and multi-line comments.
What is a block in C?
practical: Write a C program showing all parts of structure
Add comments explaining each line of code
Write a program without semicolons and fix errors
Write a program with multiple statements
Write a program using both comment types
Remove stdio.h and observe the error
Modify return value of main
Write a program with nested blocks
Write a program with wrong indentation and fix it
Rewrite an unreadable program to clean code

topics: Data types: int, float, char, double

theory: List basic data types in C.
Why is char stored as number?
What happens if variable is not initialized?
practical: Declare and print an integer variable
Declare float and print with 2 decimals
Declare char and print ASCII value
Swap two numbers using variables
Calculate sum of two numbers
Calculate area of a circle
Declare a constant PI and use it
Convert int to float and print
Write program showing wrong variable naming (commented)
Print size of all data types

theory: What happens if format specifier is wrong?
practical: Take integer input and print it
Take float input and print it
Take character input and print it
Take two numbers and print sum
Take name and age and print formatted output
Use \n and \t in output
Take three values in one scanf
Print output in aligned format
Write program with wrong specifier and fix it
Build a mini input-output demo

moduleProject.title: Student Information System (Basic)
moduleProject.description: Take student name, roll number, age, marks. Display neatly formatted output. Use variables, constants, scanf/printf, and clean structure.
